title: Chris Tarrant: former Collingwood star eyes sale for Toorak pad
text:
Former Collingwood footballer Chris Tarrant and his interior designer wife Lauren are trading a Toorak house they’ve renovated to feature sleek black and white style.

The pair snapped up 17 Glen Rd about a year and a half ago, and have since gutted and recreated it as “almost a new house”.

They’ve now listed the stately three-bedroom residence with $4.9-$5.2 million price hopes.

Ms Tarrant, who runs Lauren Tarrant Design, handled all the interior design. Her husband helped manage the project, with the build carried out by their team of tradies.

Tarrant retired from footy in 2012, following a 268-game career highlighted by All-Australian selection in 2003, winning the Anzac Day Medal in 2001, and five consecutive seasons as Collingwood’s leading goal kicker.

He also had a four-year stint playing for Fremantle, and these days has a commercial role with the Pies.

Ms Tarrant said her husband “loves the property side of things”, while she came from a family of developers so had “grown up with it”.

“We’ve been flipping houses for a while now, (mostly in) Toorak, Armadale, South Yarra,” she said.

“This is my sixth project.”

Ms Tarrant said they renovated the house purely to sell it, but ended up briefly living there as they were in the process of building themselves a new house in Toorak, using architect Paul Conrad.

She made an effort to “design a house I would like to live in myself”, featuring quality fittings and finishes including extensive marble and stone, Italian light fixtures, and dark herringbone flooring.

The reno also involved opening up the home, which had been “a bit dated” and filled with “smaller rooms” when they took it on, having not been updated since it was built by the former owner about three decades ago.

They reduced the bedrooms from four to three to create a main “retreat” with a large ensuite and walk-in wardrobe, and installed a sleek kitchen with a marble island bench, double Miele ovens and a walk-in pantry.

Kay & Burton associate Andrew Smith — who has the listing with RT Edgar Toorak’s Warwick Anderson — highlighted the property’s spa courtyard, low-maintenance garden, light-filled interior and tasteful styling.

He said its location in a quiet pocket near Kooyong Village and private schools including St Kevin’s and Scotch Colleges was also a winner.

The property’s expressions of interest campaign closes October 29.
